channel.description: Recent content in data mesh on

item.title: Aggregate domain data
item.description: In Nutshel Analytical data that is an aggregate of multiple upstream domains. Specification There is never a one-to-one mapping between a core concept of a business and a source system at an entreprise scale.

item.title: Analtical Data
item.description: In Nutshel Analytical data is the temporal, historic, and often aggregated view of the facts of the business over time. It is modeled to provide retrospective or future-perspective insights.

item.title: Consumer-aligned domain data
item.description: In Nutshel Analytical data transformed to fit the needs of one or multiple specific use cases. This is also called fit-for-purpose domain data.

item.title: Data Contract
item.description: In Nutshell It’s an API-like formal agreement between the Data Product and the data product consumer. It specifies the guarantees about a provided data set and expectations concerning Data Product usage.

item.title: Data Mesh
item.description: Data culture before Data Mesh Data collection, experimentation, and intelligence were outsourced to a separate data team. The data team was under sheer pressure.

item.title: Data Ownership
item.description: In Nutshell Decentralize the ownership of analytical data to business domains closest to the data - either the source of the data or its main consumers.

item.title: Data Product
item.description: In Nutshell With Domain ownership, the domain-oriented data is shared as a product directly with data users ( Data analyst, Data scientist).

item.title: Data Product - Addressable
item.description: The addressing system accommodates the following ever-changing aspects of a Data Product, among others, while retaining access to the Data Product through its long-lasting unique address:

item.title: Data Product - Discoverable
item.description: The Data Product itself intentionally provides discoverability information. It relies on individuals Data Products information at different points of their life cycle - build, deploy, and run - in a standard way.

item.title: Data Product - Interoperability
item.description: Here are few things Data Product need to standardize to facilitate interoperability and composability: Field type: A common explicitly defined type system Polysemes identifiers Data product global address: A unique global address allocated to each data product, ideally with a uniform scheme for ease of establishing connections to different Data Product Common metadata fields: Sucs as representation of time when data occurs and when data is recorded Schema linking: Ability to link and reuse schema - types - defined by other Data Products Data linking: Ability to ling or map to data in other Data Products Schema stability: Approach to evolving schemas that respects backward compatibility

item.title: Data Product - Natively accessible
item.description: There is a direct link between the usability of a Data Product and how easily a particular data user can access it with their native tools.

item.title: Data Product - Secure
item.description: In a distributed architecture like Data Mesh, the access control is validated by the Data Product, right in the flow of data, access, read, or write.

item.title: Data Product - Trustworthy & truthful
item.description: A piece of closing the gap is to guarantee and communicate Data Products’ Service-level objectives (SLOs) - objective measures that remove uncertainty surrounding the data.

item.title: Data Product - Understandable
item.description: Each Data Product provides semantically coherent data: data with a specific meaning. A data user needs to understand this meaning; what kind of entities the Data Product encapsulates, what the relationships among the entities are, and their adjacent Data Products.

item.title: Data Product - Valuable on its own
item.description: A Data Product should carry a dataset that is valuable and meaningful on its own - without being joined and correlated with other Data Products.

item.title: Federated Computational Governance
item.description: In Nutshell Motivations Ability to get higher-order value from aggregation and correlation of independent yet interoperable data products Countering the undesirable consequences of domain-oriented decentralizations Reducing the overhead of manual synchronization between domains and the governance function

item.title: Operational Data
item.description: In Nutshel Operational data supports running the business and keeps the current state of the business with transactional integrity. This data is captured, stored, and processed by transactions in real time, by OLTP (Online Transaction Processing) systems.

item.title: Polysemes
item.description: In Nutshel Polysemes are shared concepts across different domains. They point to the same entity, with domain-specific attributes. Polysemes represent shared core concepts in a business such as artist, listener, and song.

item.title: Self-Serve Data Platform
item.description: In Nutshell It is a new generation of self-serve data platform services that empower domainsâ€™ cross-functional teams to share data. The platform services are centered around removing friction from the end-to-end journey of data sharing, from source to consumption.

item.title: Semantic model
item.description: Machine and human-readable model definition that captures the domain model of the data: How the data product models the domain, what types of entities the data includes, the properties of the entities, the relationships between the entities, etc.

item.title: Service-level objectives
item.description: SLO list Data quality metrics [!important]- Accuracy The degree of how closely the data represents the true value of the attribute in the real-world context

item.title: Source-aligned domain data
item.description: In Nutshel Analytical data reflecting the business facts generated by the operational systems. This is also called a native data product .

item.title: Syntax model
item.description: Data Product encodes its semantic according to the access models supported by its output ports. This the syntax model. Every output port will model have its own syntax model.
